sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The heartie confession of a Christian deuised for his owne comfort, written for his remembrance, and now published for the vse of M.H. and others his faithfull and priuate friends onely.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed by Thomas Orwin, for Christopher Hunt, At London : 1593.
Verse - "The somme of all the comforts, which I finde". With marginal notes. At head of title: There bee many that speake much of Iesus Christ, and beare a faire shew of his holines and vertue .. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
The heartie confession of a Christian deuised for his owne comfort, written for his remembrance, and now published for the vse of M.H. and others his faithfull and priuate friends onely.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
Printed by Thomas Orwin, for Christopher Hunt, At London : 1593.
Verse - "The somme of all the comforts, which I finde". With marginal notes. At head of title: There bee many that speake much of Iesus Christ, and beare a faire shew of his holines and vertue .. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Christopher Hunt
Thomas Orwin
>>>>>>> imprintparse
